trans-unit.source: An Azure virtual machine supports attaching a number of data disks.
trans-unit.target: An Azure virtual machine supports attaching a number of data disks.

trans-unit.source: For optimal performance, you will want to limit the number of highly utilized disks attached to the virtual machine to avoid possible throttling.
trans-unit.target: For optimal performance, you will want to limit the number of highly utilized disks attached to the virtual machine to avoid possible throttling.

trans-unit.source: If all disks are not being highly utilized at the same time, the storage account can support a larger number disks.
trans-unit.target: If all disks are not being highly utilized at the same time, the storage account can support a larger number disks.

trans-unit.source: **For standard storage accounts:** A standard storage account has a maximum total request rate of 20,000 IOPS.
trans-unit.target: **For standard storage accounts:** A standard storage account has a maximum total request rate of 20,000 IOPS.

trans-unit.source: The total IOPS across all of your virtual machine disks in a standard storage account should not exceed this limit.
trans-unit.target: The total IOPS across all of your virtual machine disks in a standard storage account should not exceed this limit.

trans-unit.source: You can roughly calculate the number of highly utilized disks supported by a single standard storage account based on the request rate limit.
trans-unit.target: You can roughly calculate the number of highly utilized disks supported by a single standard storage account based on the request rate limit.

trans-unit.source: For example, for a Basic Tier VM, the maximum number of highly utilized disks is about 66 (20,000/300 IOPS per disk), and for a Standard Tier VM, it is about 40 (20,000/500 IOPS per disk), as shown in the table below.

trans-unit.source: **For premium storage accounts:** A premium storage account has a maximum total throughput rate of 50 Gbps.
trans-unit.target: **For premium storage accounts:** A premium storage account has a maximum total throughput rate of 50 Gbps.

trans-unit.source: The total throughput across all of your VM disks should not exceed this limit.
